snippet.textDisplay:
Hi! This application was so different from the one for the Pyeongchang Games. I really don't if they will let you change, and maybe each games has a different policy - but I feel like it could be open to discussion. Last time, I wasn't assigned to the venue I ended up with, I called and requested and luckily they moved me. But I don't want to say that is the usual case!

Now I have a question for you - I just submitted my application, did you receive a confirmation email after you sent your application?

snippet.textOriginal: @Schalke M hello,did you apply for Olympics ?I applied,but didn't get any letters for interview...

snippet.textDisplay: Hi! Thanks for your comment, I'd be happy to give you more info. Hopefully Beijing22 still happens - or it looks like it will be pushed later. :/ Volunteers during the PyeongChang games were put in different places to stay based on where they volunteered, not the Olympic Village. I was put in a hostel about 30 minutes from where I volunteered, it depends on the bus route they had. It felt nice enough for my purposes staying there. In terms of finances, I paid for my plane tickets round trip (which were about $1300 in my case) and anything I needed to bring. It's up to you how much you want to spend on extra food or items, or on weekends if you feel you want to travel elsewhere. But overall they provided where we stayed, meals at the hostel and site where you worked depending on your schedule, and transportation to and from work. It may not be the most luxurious of circumstances, but for me it was worth it and the best experience of my life if that's what you're looking for!
snippet.textOriginal: Hi! Thanks for your comment, I'd be happy to give you more info. But overall they provided where we stayed, meals at the hostel and site where you worked depending on your schedule, and transportation to and from work. It may not be the most luxurious of circumstances, but for me it was worth it and the best experience of my life if that's what you're looking for!

snippet.textDisplay: @Thảo Vân Đỗ Trần I'm so sorry, I totally thought I responded to this! I also plan on applying for next year. The only fee I had to pay was my travel there and any essentials I wanted to bring. They provided a place to stay and the transportation to and from work, and meals. I can't really say a dollar amount it would cost because that would depend on how much you feel you need to prep for it. I prepared enough to stay for a month - bought winter clothes and items I thought would help me. I probably could have gone with less. I didn't attend the Paralympic either, it was too much time off of work to do that. And thank you for commenting!
snippet.textOriginal: @Thảo Vân Đỗ Trần I'm so sorry, I totally thought I responded to this! I also plan on applying for next year. The only fee I had to pay was my travel there and any essentials I wanted to bring. They provided a place to stay and the transportation to and from work, and meals. I prepared enough to stay for a month - bought winter clothes and items I thought would help me. I probably could have gone with less. snippet.textDisplay: Did you have to learn Korean to be a volunteer?
snippet.textOriginal: Did you have to learn Korean to be a volunteer?

snippet.textDisplay: I didn't have to learn Korean, but they did require me to take a Korean language course. It was only for completion, no pass or fail test. Most signs there were in English and pretty much everyone spoke English too, and were very nice.
snippet.textOriginal: I didn't have to learn Korean, but they did require me to take a Korean language course. It was only for completion, no pass or fail test. Most signs there were in English and pretty much everyone spoke English too, and were very nice.

snippet.textDisplay: How did you volunteer exactly? Do they just accept everyone who wants to volunteer or do you have to have some kind of background?
snippet.textOriginal: How did you volunteer exactly? Do they just accept everyone who wants to volunteer or do you have to have some kind of background?

snippet.textDisplay: Hi! It's an application process that they send out about a year and half before each games! There is an interview process so not everyone is accepted. I think it helps to have a background or passion for some sport, but you definitely don't have to have one. It just needs to be clear that you would be a hard worker and are passionate about the games, and are able to get there :)
snippet.textOriginal: Hi! It's an application process that they send out about a year and half before each games! There is an interview process so not everyone is accepted. I think it helps to have a background or passion for some sport, but you definitely don't have to have one. It just needs to be clear that you would be a hard worker and are passionate about the games, and are able to get there :)
